TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by Mr P. A. GPE , the representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant receives an old age pension . As his pension due for the period from DATE had not been paid to him he applied to a court .
On DATE the ORG of GPE found for the applicant , ordering ORG to pay him MONEY ( RUR ) in arrears as delayed pension payments and CARDINAL ORG as inflation losses .
On DATE ORG , on the defendant 's appeal , quashed the judgment in a part related to the court award for inflation losses , having confirmed the remaining part concerning the pension in arrears .
The applicant brought a second action against ORG for non - pecuniary damages allegedly sustained as a result of the delay in pension payments .

On DATE the NORP ORG of GPE rejected the applicant 's claim . The court found that the delay in payment of pension occurred on account of the failure of organizations and individuals to pay pension contributions in time for which the pension authority can not be held responsible . The court further maintained that the claim had no basis in domestic law .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal against the judgment .

The applicant 's subsequent requests to ORG of GPE pursuing the reopening of the case concerning non - pecuniary damages by way of supervisory review proceedings were unsuccessful , of which he was informed by letters of DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE .

On DATE , following an application of ORG by way of supervisory review , the ORG of ORG quashed the decision of the appeal court of DATE in a part concerning the inflation losses and upheld the original judgment of DATE in this respect .
